Rarely artificially created, drowned mummies are miserable, dripping undead that have adapted to exist in an aquatic environment, usually over centuries, after their tomb or lair becomes flooded. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 41 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 [Drowned Mummy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2420) **Source** [Pathfinder #186: Ghost King's Rage](/Sources.aspx?ID=189) pg. 81 **Perception** +30; aquatic echolocation 120 feet, [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Aquan](/Languages.aspx?ID=14), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); plus any two ancient languages; [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) (30 feet) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +30, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +32, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +28, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +30, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +30 **Str** +9 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** +3 **Wis** +7 **Cha** +1 **Aquatic Echolocation** A drowned mummy can use its hearing as a [precise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=411) at the listed range but only underwater. **Items** _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [trident](/Weapons.aspx?ID=45)_ --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +29 **Ref** +28 **Will** +32 **HP** 330 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 15 **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)**
**Water Pressure** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) 30 feet. A creature that begins its turn within the aura feels overburdened by the weight of the water around it and must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or become [encumbered](/Conditions.aspx?ID=12) for as long as it remains in the area. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to water pressure for 24 hours. Water pressure only functions while the drowned mummy is underwater and can only affect creatures that are in contact with the same body of water. --- **Speed** 25 feet, swim 40 feet **Melee** _trident_ +33 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d8+15 piercing plus aquatic advantage **Melee** fist +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d8+15 bludgeoning plus aquatic advantage and rancid bloat **Ranged** trident +31 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 3d8+15 bludgeoning plus Aquatic Advantage **Aquatic Advantage** A drowned mummy's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 damage against creatures in the same body of water as the drowned mummy. **[Aquatic Ambush](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=2)** **Rancid Bloat** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) This disease and damage from it can't be healed unless this curse is removed. A creature killed by rancid bloat rots away to waterlogged pieces of flesh and can't be resurrected except by an 8th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic. **Saving Throw** DC 38 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier with no ill effect (1 minute); **Stage 2** 12d6 negative damage, [clumsy 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3), and [enfeebled 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) (1 day); **Stage 3** 16d6 negative damage, clumsy 4, and enfeebled 4 (1 day) **Whirlpool** ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) **Requirements** The drowned mummy is underwater; **Effect** The drowned mummy commands the water to churn, creating a powerful whirlpool centered on itself. Each creature within a 30-foot emanation centered on the drowned mummy takes 14d8 bludgeoning damage (DC 38 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save) as the powerful current batters them around. A creature that fails this save is pushed 20 feet away from the mummy and also falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) on a critical failure. The drowned mummy can't use Whirlpool again for 1d4 rounds.
Environmental Adaptations Mummies are resolute, refusing to abandon their tombs, burial sites, or lairs regardless of the changes wrought to these locations through the ages. Over the centuries, this stubbornness drives adaptation and innovation, resulting in mummies closely tied to their environments— no matter how weird!
